summary: This bill, the National Strategy for School Security Act of 2025, aims to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002. It mandates the Secretary of Homeland Security, in collaboration with the Secretary of Education and other relevant agencies, to create a national strategy to secure elementary and secondary schools against terrorism. The strategy, to be submitted to relevant congressional committees, must detail federal programs, identify vulnerabilities, outline goals, describe actions, and avoid duplication of existing efforts. Annual updates are required through 2033.
